proverb: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
Even the best cooking pot will not produce food.
Fall seven times, stand up eight.
When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
No matter how long the night, the day is sure to come.
A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
A single bracelet does not jingle.
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
The child who is not embraced by the village will burn it down to feel its warmth.
Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.
Even a clock that does not work is right twice a day.
A bad workman always blames his tools.
Empty vessels make the most noise.
Talk doesn’t cook rice.
It takes a whole village to raise a child.
When one door closes, another opens.
To run is not necessarily to arrive.
You can't wake a person who is pretending to be asleep.
Beware of little expenses; a small leak will sink a great ship.
A tiger does not proclaim its tigritude, it pounces.
Little by little, the bird builds its nest.
Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
When elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
Better an egg today than a hen tomorrow.
A stitch in time saves nine.
If the shoe fits, wear it.
You can’t make an omelet without breaking eggs.
If you chase two rabbits, you will catch neither.
Even monkeys fall from trees.
A closed mouth catches no flies.
Do not call the forest that shelters you a jungle.
Don’t cross the bridge until you come to it.
A man is not a man until he has a house of his own.
He who digs a pit for others falls in himself.
A gentle hand may lead even an elephant by a single hair.
The nail that sticks out gets hammered down.
A fool says what he knows, and a wise man knows what he says.
A hungry stomach has no ears.
The leopard does not change his spots.
He who learns, teaches.
No bees, no honey; no work, no money.
Too many captains sink the ship.
When the character of a man is not clear to you, look at his friends.
A man without culture is like a zebra without stripes.
The more you know, the less you need.
Where there is love, there is no darkness.
He who is destined for power does not have to fight for it.
Even a small star shines in the darkness.
Patience is a tree whose root is bitter, but its fruit is very sweet.
The night rinses what the day has soaped.
The one who loves an unsightly person is the one who makes him beautiful.
A man who counts his money after a party will be counting forever.
Milk the cow but do not pull off the udder.
If you're not part of the solution, you're part of the problem.
He who wants a rose must respect the thorn.
The frog does not drink up the pond in which he lives.
A guest is a jewel on the cushion of hospitality.
The palm of the hand cannot cover the sun.
He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
The axe forgets, but the tree remembers.
Don't set sail on someone else's star.
Don’t let your tongue cut your throat.
Even the lion, the king of the forest, protects himself against flies.
The road to a friend’s house is never long.
A man does not wander far from where his corn is roasting.
A single stick may smoke, but it will not burn.
To understand the road ahead, ask those coming back.
The person who has not traveled widely thinks his mother is the best cook.
If you offend, ask for pardon; if offended, forgive.
You learn how to cut down trees by cutting them down.
Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
A horse may be coaxed to drink, but a pencil must be lead.
A bad bush is better than the open field.
No matter how hot your anger is, it cannot cook yams.
Don’t insult the crocodile until you cross the river.
A dog with a bone in his mouth can't bite.
A boat doesn’t go forward if each one is rowing their own way.
Wisdom is wealth.
You must act as if it is impossible to fail.
A cutting word is worse than a bowstring, a cut may heal, but the cut of the tongue does not.
If the lion doesn’t tell his story, the hunter will.
A spider’s web united can tie up a lion.
When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
Rain beats the leopard’s skin but does not wash out the spots.
Wisdom is like fire. People take it from others.
A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
Don’t think there are no crocodiles just because the water is calm.
By crawling, a child learns to stand.
Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable.
One who loves you warns you.
Wisdom does not come overnight.
The house of a person we love is never far.
Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
If you climb up a tree, you must climb down the same tree.
One finger cannot remove a louse.
Not to know is bad; not to wish to know is worse.
He who is being carried does not realize how far the town is.
